definitions: made or shaped to follow the exact contours or measurements of something
properly equipped, furnished or supplied with necessary items or skills
examples: She wore a perfectly fitted dress to the gala
The fitted sheets stayed secure on the mattress
The newly fitted kitchen has modern appliances
Every soldier is fitted with proper combat gear

definitions: in better physical condition with greater strength or health
more appropriate or suitable for a particular purpose or situation
examples: After months of training, she's fitter than ever
The younger athletes were fitter and faster
This candidate seems fitter for the demanding role
A smaller car would be fitter for city driving

definitions: suitable or appropriate for particular circumstances or purposes
in the process of being fitted or adjusted to size
examples: It was a fitting tribute to her years of service
The solemn music created a fitting atmosphere
The fitting room was occupied by another customer
Schedule a fitting appointment for your wedding dress

definitions: amounting to the number five in quantity or position
examples: The five children played together in the park
She received five different job offers this month

definitions: five times as great or as much in number or amount
examples: The company experienced a fivefold increase in profits
Population growth was fivefold over the decade

definitions: fastened securely in position and not able to move or be moved
predetermined and not subject to change or variation in amount
repaired or mended to restore proper functioning condition
examples: The mirror was fixed firmly to the bathroom wall
Her eyes remained fixed on the distant horizon
They work for a fixed salary every month
The meeting occurs at fixed intervals throughout the year
The broken computer has finally been fixed
Once the leak was fixed, everything worked fine

definitions: soft, loose, and lacking firmness or muscle tone in texture
examples: His flaccid handshake conveyed a lack of confidence
The plant's leaves became flaccid without water

definitions: becoming tired, weak, or less enthusiastic and losing energy or momentum
examples: The team's flagging spirits needed a motivational boost
Sales showed flagging performance in the third quarter

definitions: conspicuously offensive, shocking, or reprehensible in an obvious way that cannot be ignored
examples: The referee penalized the player for a flagrant foul
This was a flagrant violation of company policy

definitions: breaking or separating easily into small thin flat pieces or layers
unreliable and likely to cancel plans or behave unpredictably
examples: The flaky pastry crumbled at the slightest touch
Her scalp was dry and flaky from the cold weather
Don't count on him, he's been really flaky lately
Their flaky attendance record caused concern

definitions: tending to attract attention through being exuberant, colorful, or unconventionally styled
examples: His flamboyant personality made him popular at parties
She wore flamboyant costumes on stage

definitions: burning with flames or appearing to burn with bright fire
showing intense passion, anger, or other strong emotion
examples: The flaming torch lit up the dark cave
Flaming arrows flew through the night sky
They had a flaming argument about politics
His flaming temper got him into trouble

definitions: easily set on fire and capable of burning rapidly when exposed to flame
examples: Store flammable materials away from heat sources
The warehouse contained highly flammable chemicals

definitions: gradually widening or spreading outward from a narrower point
suddenly burning or shining more brightly or intensely
examples: She wore pants with flaring bell bottoms
The flaring nostrils showed his anger
The flaring match illuminated his face briefly
Flaring tempers disrupted the peaceful meeting

definitions: expensive and ostentatious in a showy or vulgar way
happening very quickly or lasting for an extremely brief time
examples: He drove a flash sports car to impress everyone
The flash jewelry looked out of place
It was just a flash decision made without thinking
The flash sale lasted only two hours

definitions: ostentatiously attractive or impressive in a superficial or vulgar way
examples: His flashy gold watch attracted unwanted attention
The restaurant's flashy decor didn't match the simple menu

definitions: having a smooth, level surface without raised areas or indentations
lacking emotion, enthusiasm, or energy in tone or manner
complete and definite with no qualification or doubt expressed
having lost air pressure and unable to maintain proper shape
examples: The flat prairie stretched for miles ahead
She ironed the shirt until it was completely flat
His flat voice betrayed no emotion whatsoever
The joke fell flat with the audience
She gave a flat refusal to their request
That's a flat lie and you know it
The car had a flat tire this morning
The soda tasted flat after sitting open

definitions: pressed or crushed to become flat or flatter than before
examples: The flattened cardboard boxes were ready for recycling
His nose looked flattened from old boxing injuries

definitions: expressing praise or admiration, often excessively or insincerely
making someone look attractive or showing them to best advantage
examples: She made flattering comments about his presentation
The review was flattering but not entirely accurate
That dress is very flattering on your figure
The soft lighting was flattering to everyone

definitions: having defects, mistakes, or weaknesses that prevent perfection
examples: The flawed diamond was worth much less money
Their flawed reasoning led to wrong conclusions

definitions: without any imperfections, defects, or mistakes of any kind
examples: Her flawless performance earned a standing ovation
The diamond had a flawless clarity rating

definitions: fully developed and able to function independently or completely
examples: The startup became a fully fledged company
He's now a fledged member of the team

definitions: new and inexperienced, just beginning to develop or operate
examples: The fledgling business needed more investment capital
She offered advice to fledgling writers

definitions: able to move very quickly with light rapid movements
examples: The fleet runner won every race easily
Her fleet fingers danced across the piano keys

definitions: lasting for a very short time before disappearing or ending
examples: She caught a fleeting glimpse of the celebrity
Their happiness was fleeting and soon faded

definitions: having a soft, plump quality with substantial soft tissue
examples: The plant had thick fleshy leaves for storing water
His fleshy face showed signs of good living

definitions: capable of bending easily without breaking or losing shape
willing and able to change or adapt to different circumstances
examples: The flexible rubber hose bent around corners easily
Dancers need flexible bodies for their performances
She has a flexible schedule this week
We need flexible thinkers for this project

definitions: shining or burning unsteadily with a wavering light that goes on and off
examples: The flickering candle cast dancing shadows on walls
A flickering computer screen needs immediate repair

definitions: lacking the ability to fly despite being a bird species
examples: Penguins are flightless birds adapted for swimming
The dodo was a famous flightless bird

definitions: weak and insubstantial in construction, easily damaged or destroyed
weak and unconvincing, lacking substance or credibility
examples: The flimsy cardboard box fell apart immediately
That flimsy fence won't keep anything out
She gave a flimsy excuse for being late
The prosecution had only flimsy evidence

definitions: made of or resembling flint stone in hardness or sharpness
examples: His flint eyes showed no mercy or compassion
The flint tools were sharp enough to cut

definitions: showing inappropriate lack of seriousness or respect in manner
examples: His flip comment offended several board members
Don't be flip about such serious matters

definitions: behaving in a playfully romantic or sexually suggestive way to attract attention
examples: Her flirtatious smile caught his attention immediately
He was being openly flirtatious at the party

definitions: remaining suspended or moving on the surface of a liquid
not permanently fixed or settled in position or value
examples: Floating ice posed danger to the ships
There were leaves floating in the pool
The company offers floating work hours to employees
Countries adopted floating exchange rates

definitions: covered or filled with an excessive amount of water
overwhelmed with an excessive amount of something
examples: The flooded basement required immediate water removal
Flooded streets made driving impossible
The company was flooded with job applications
She felt flooded with conflicting emotions

definitions: illuminated by powerful broad beams of artificial light
examples: The floodlit stadium was visible from miles away
They played on the floodlit tennis courts

definitions: knocked down to the floor or ground by force
completely surprised or astonished beyond expectation
examples: The boxer was floored by a powerful uppercut
One punch floored the challenger
I was absolutely floored by her unexpected resignation
The generous donation floored everyone

definitions: soft and flexible, tending to hang or move loosely
examples: The dog's floppy ears bounced as it ran
She wore a floppy sun hat to the beach

definitions: decorated with or depicting flowers, or relating to flowers
examples: She wore a beautiful floral dress to the garden party
The room had floral wallpaper

definitions: elaborately intricate or complicated in style, often excessively ornate
having a red or flushed complexion
examples: His florid prose style made the text difficult to read
The florid decoration seemed excessive
His florid face suggested high blood pressure
After drinking, his complexion became florid

definitions: developing rapidly and successfully in a vigorous way
examples: The flourishing business expanded to three locations
Their flourishing garden produced abundant vegetables

definitions: decorated with a pattern or design of flowers
examples: She chose flowered curtains for the bedroom
The flowered wallpaper brightened the room

definitions: producing flowers or in the process of blooming
experiencing a period of development and success
examples: The flowering plants attracted many bees
Spring brings flowering trees to the park
The Renaissance was a flowering period of art
We witnessed the flowering of democracy

definitions: covered with flowers or floral patterns
using elaborate and ornate language that is often excessive
examples: The flowery meadow was perfect for a picnic
She wore a flowery summer dress
His flowery speech went on far too long
The flowery language obscured the simple message

definitions: moving along smoothly and continuously in a steady stream or current
examples: Her flowing hair moved gracefully in the wind
The dancer wore a flowing silk gown

definitions: rising and falling irregularly in number, amount, or quality
examples: The fluctuating prices made budgeting difficult
Her fluctuating moods concerned her family

definitions: able to speak or write a language easily, accurately, and articulately
examples: She's fluent in three different languages
After years abroad, he became fluent in Japanese

definitions: soft, light, and airy in texture like fur or feathers
examples: The fluffy kitten curled up on the cushion
She served fluffy scrambled eggs for breakfast

definitions: flowing easily and smoothly with graceful movement
not fixed or stable, likely to change or adapt
examples: The dancer's fluid movements mesmerized the audience
She writes in a fluid, elegant style
The situation remains fluid and unpredictable
We need to keep our plans fluid

definitions: emitting light by fluorescence, producing a bright artificial light
examples: The office had harsh fluorescent lighting overhead
She wore a fluorescent yellow safety vest
